books.title: The Well of Loneliness
books.author: Radclyffe Hall
books.summary: A young woman struggles to understand and accept herself, and particularly her love of other women, in a society that rejects her unconventional behavior as unfeminine and even unnatural.

books.title: Kidnapped
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After his parents die, a young Scottish man travels to see his only remaining relative, expecting to be welcomed, but instead finds his life and liberty in grave danger.

books.title: Running a Thousand Miles for Freedom
books.author: William Craft
books.summary: The authors escape from slavery by posing as a slaveowner and his slave.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: The Railway Children
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: After their father is forced to leave them, three children and their mother must live in near-poverty in the country, where their lives are enlivened by the nearby presence of a railway line.

books.title: Brewster’s Millions
books.author: George Barr McCutcheon
books.summary: A young man stands to gain a fortune—but only if he loses one first.

books.title: Measure for Measure
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: A duke pretends to leave Vienna so that he can observe his deputy’s management during his supposed absence.

books.title: The Lost World
books.author: Arthur Conan Doyle
books.summary: A team of scientists and adventurers explores a prehistoric land.

books.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: The adventures of a young boy and his friend, an escaped slave, on the Mississippi river in the Antebellum South.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frank Belknap Long
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Frank Belknap Long, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: South!
books.author: Ernest Shackleton
books.summary: A British expedition sets off to cross Antarctica, but when their ship is wrecked they have to face a long struggle for survival.

books.title: The Big Bow Mystery
books.author: Israel Zangwill
books.summary: A seemingly impossible murder committed during the trade union movement becomes the obsession of London’s Bow district.

books.title: Struggles and Triumphs
books.author: P. T. Barnum
books.summary: The world’s greatest showman tells the story of his life.

books.title: The Crowd
books.author: Gustave Le Bon
books.summary: Le Bon explores the psychology, motivations, and dangers of crowds of people.

books.title: Spoon River Anthology
books.author: Edgar Lee Masters
books.summary: A collection of short poems recounting the lives and deaths of the residents of a small Illinois town.

books.title: The History of Rasselas, Prince of Abyssinia
books.author: Samuel Johnson
books.summary: An Abyssinian prince embarks on adventures while exploring the meaning of happiness.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Ray Bradbury
books.summary: A collection of science fiction and fantasy stories by Ray Bradbury ordered by date of publication.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of P. G. Wodehouse’s short fiction.

books.title: Orthodoxy
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton’s unique view on Christianity and how all his “solitary and sincere speculations” were ultimately answered by its theology.

books.title: Journals
books.author: Alexander Mackenzie
books.summary: Explorer Alexander Mackenzie details his journeys to both the Arctic and Pacific Oceans in his personal journals.
